pricingSection.title: Price Information
pricingSection.subtitle: When it comes to the Savannah breed, price is not just a number. It is a reflection of exclusivity, origin and uniqueness of each cat.

f1.title: Savannah F1
f1.description: First generation, direct cross between a Serval and domestic cat. Maximum wildness and similarity to Serval.
f1.priceNote: Sometimes reaches 35,000+ EUR for rare color cats
f1.note: F1 ‚Äî it's status, collectibility and living exclusivity

f2.title: Savannah F2
f2.description: Second generation. Serval share is smaller, but exotic appearance is still pronounced.
f2.note: More affordable price while maintaining impressive appearance

f3f4.title: Savannah F3-F4
f3f4.description: Third and fourth generations. More docile, but retain exotic appearance.
f3f4.note: Great balance between appearance and character for home keeping

f5plus.title: Savannah F5+
f5plus.description: Distant generations. Closer in character to domestic cat, but retain part of exotic appearance.
f5plus.note: More affordable option while maintaining breed beauty

factor1.title: Color and pattern
factor1.description: Rare colors (snow, silver, melanistic) are significantly more expensive than standard spotted colors

factor2.title: Size and build
factor2.description: The larger the Savannah and the more pronounced its wild features (big ears, long legs), the higher the price

factor3.title: Gender
factor3.description: F1 and F2 males are valued more than females

factor4.title: Pedigree and cattery
factor4.description: Kittens from titled parents and famous catteries cost significantly more

factor5.title: Age
factor5.description: Kittens are more expensive than adult cats. Highest demand for kittens aged 3-6 months

factor6.title: Generation (F1‚ÄìF7)
factor6.description: The closer to the Serval (F1), the higher the price

pricingSection.valueTitle: ‚ú® It's not just a purchase - it's an investment
pricingSection.valueDesc: Savannah is not a pet. It's emotions, uniqueness and living status. The price reflects exclusivity, rarity and breeding costs. Acquiring a Savannah is an investment in a companion who will remain with you forever as part of your story.

raritySection.title: Rarity and Uniqueness
raritySection.subtitle: Savannah - the rarest diamond in the cat world
raritySection.intro: Savannah is not just a cat. It is an embodiment of wild grace, intelligence and true status. These cats are the result of unique crossing of African serval and domestic cat, and each Savannah is a living work of art, born by nature and genetic precision.

rarity.title: üí´ Rarity worthy of collectors
rarity.description: Savannah is one of the rarest and most expensive breeds in the world. Due to complex breeding process and strict quality standards, a very limited number of kittens are born per year. Each representative of this breed is literally a single specimen, and being among Savannah owners is a privilege available to few.

beauty.title: üåü Wild beauty in every movement
beauty.description: Savannah looks as if it just came out of the African savannah. Large, muscular, with spotted coat and incredibly expressive eyes. Its grace and manner of movement fascinate - this is real predatory elegance enclosed in the body of a domestic pet.

intelligence.title: üß† Intelligence beyond any expectations
intelligence.description: Savannah is one of the smartest cat breeds. It easily learns commands, gets used to a leash and can even play fetch. These cats love water, can open doors and drawers, and their curiosity and ingenuity exceed almost any domestic breed.

character.title: üíé Unique character
character.description: Savannah is not a typical independent cat. It is extremely social, loyal and attached to its owner like a dog. These cats are active, playful and require constant attention. With Savannah, life becomes more dynamic and brighter.

status.title: üëë Status symbol
status.description: Savannah is not just a pet, it is a symbol of success. This breed is available only to those who are ready to invest in a unique animal. Owning a Savannah emphasizes taste, status and love for the unusual.

companion.title: üåç Companion for life
companion.description: Savannah is not just a cat that will live nearby. It is a true friend who will greet you, play, communicate and delight every day. The bond with Savannah is unique - it is a relationship at the level of partnership and true friendship.

seo.description: Get answers to frequently asked questions about Savannah cats. Learn about F1 vs F2 differences, prices, care, legality, personality, diet, and how to buy a Savannah cat from SavannahMonarchy.

cta.title: Still Have Questions?
cta.subtitle: Our team is ready to help you find your perfect Savannah companion

whatIsSavannah.question: What is a Savannah cat?
whatIsSavannah.answer: A Savannah cat is a hybrid breed created by crossing a domestic cat with an African Serval. They are known for their striking spotted coat, tall and lean body, large ears, and wild appearance combined with a domestic temperament. Savannah cats are highly intelligent, active, and form strong bonds with their owners.

savannahPrice.question: How much does a Savannah cat cost?
savannahPrice.answer:
Savannah cat prices vary significantly by generation:

‚Ä¢ F1 Savannah: ‚Ç¨10,000 - ‚Ç¨25,000 (sometimes up to ‚Ç¨35,000+)
‚Ä¢ F2 Savannah: ‚Ç¨7,500 - ‚Ç¨15,000
‚Ä¢ F3 Savannah: ‚Ç¨4,000 - ‚Ç¨8,000
‚Ä¢ F4-F5 Savannah: ‚Ç¨1,500 - ‚Ç¨5,000

Prices depend on gender (males are usually more expensive), coat quality, and breeder reputation.

f1VsF2.question: What's the difference between F1 and F2 Savannah cats?
f1VsF2.answer: F1 Savannah cats are first-generation hybrids (50% Serval) - they are the largest, most exotic-looking, and most expensive. F2 Savannah cats are second-generation (25% Serval) - slightly smaller but still maintain many wild characteristics. F1s require more experienced owners due to their stronger wild instincts, while F2s are often more adaptable to typical household environments.

savannahSize.question: How big do Savannah cats get?
savannahSize.answer:
Savannah cat size varies by generation:

‚Ä¢ F1 males: 7-11 kg, up to 43 cm tall
‚Ä¢ F1 females: 6-9 kg
‚Ä¢ F2 males: 7-9 kg, 35-40 cm tall
‚Ä¢ F2 females: 5-7 kg
‚Ä¢ Later generations (F3-F5): 4-7 kg

They are among the tallest domestic cats, with long legs and lean bodies.

savannahPersonality.question: What is the personality of a Savannah cat?
savannahPersonality.answer:
Savannah cats are often described as 'dog-like' in their behavior. They are:

‚Ä¢ Highly intelligent and trainable
‚Ä¢ Extremely loyal and bond strongly with their owners
‚Ä¢ Very active and playful, requiring lots of stimulation
‚Ä¢ Curious and adventurous
‚Ä¢ Social and often enjoy water
‚Ä¢ Can learn to walk on a leash and play fetch

They require more attention and interaction than typical domestic cats.

savannahLegal.question: Are Savannah cats legal to own?
savannahLegal.answer:
Legality varies by location.

üá∫üá∏ USA:
‚Ä¢ Legal in most states with no restrictions
‚Ä¢ Some states require permits (Texas, Massachusetts)
‚Ä¢ Banned in Hawaii, Georgia, and some local jurisdictions
‚Ä¢ F1-F2 generations may have additional restrictions

üá™üá∫ Europe:
‚Ä¢ In most EU countries, F3-F5 Savannahs are legal to own
‚Ä¢ F1-F2 may require special permits in Germany, France, Belgium
‚Ä¢ In the UK, F1 requires a DWA (Dangerous Wild Animals) license
‚Ä¢ Scandinavian countries have stricter rules for early generations

üá∑üá∫ Russia:
‚Ä¢ Legal to own all generations of Savannah
‚Ä¢ Registration with veterinary authorities is recommended
‚Ä¢ Veterinary documents are required for transport between regions

üåè Asia:
‚Ä¢ Popular and legal in UAE and Qatar with registration
‚Ä¢ Legal in Japan, but F1-F2 require government notification
‚Ä¢ Singapore and Hong Kong may require permits
‚Ä¢ Rules vary by province in China

Always check local laws before purchasing. We provide guidance on legality in your area.

savannahLifespan.question: How long do Savannah cats live?
savannahLifespan.answer:
Savannah cats typically live 12-20 years with proper care. Their lifespan is comparable to or longer than most domestic cat breeds. Key factors for longevity include:

‚Ä¢ Quality nutrition
‚Ä¢ Regular veterinary care
‚Ä¢ Mental and physical stimulation
‚Ä¢ Safe indoor environment

savannahCare.question: How do you care for a Savannah cat?
savannahCare.answer:
Savannah cats require specific care:

‚Ä¢ Large living space with climbing structures
‚Ä¢ High-quality, protein-rich diet
‚Ä¢ Daily interactive play sessions (1-2 hours)
‚Ä¢ Mental stimulation through puzzle toys and training
‚Ä¢ Regular grooming (weekly brushing)
‚Ä¢ Secure outdoor space or leash walking
‚Ä¢ Annual veterinary checkups

We provide detailed care guides with every purchase.

savannahDiet.question: What do Savannah cats eat?
savannahDiet.answer:
Savannah cats thrive on a high-protein diet:

‚Ä¢ Premium grain-free cat food
‚Ä¢ Raw meat (chicken, turkey, beef)
‚Ä¢ Wet food for hydration
‚Ä¢ Avoid foods with fillers and grains

F1 and F2 generations especially benefit from raw diets due to their closer genetic link to wild cats. We provide detailed feeding guidelines with each kitten.

savannahOtherPets.question: Can Savannah cats live with other pets?
savannahOtherPets.answer:
Yes, with proper introduction:

‚Ä¢ Best introduced to other pets as kittens
‚Ä¢ Generally good with dogs, especially if raised together
‚Ä¢ May dominate smaller cats due to size
‚Ä¢ Not recommended with small prey animals (hamsters, birds)
‚Ä¢ Early socialization is key

Our kittens are well-socialized before going to their new homes.

savannahChildren.question: Are Savannah cats good with children?
savannahChildren.answer:
Savannah cats can be excellent family pets:

‚Ä¢ Later generations (F3-F5) are generally better for families with young children
‚Ä¢ F1-F2 are better suited for families with older, respectful children
‚Ä¢ They are playful and enjoy interactive games
‚Ä¢ Supervision is recommended with any pet and young children
‚Ä¢ Their high energy matches well with active families

buyingSavannah.question: How do I buy a Savannah cat from SavannahMonarchy?
buyingSavannah.answer:
Our purchasing process:

1. Browse our available kittens in the catalog
2. Contact us to express interest and ask questions
3. Submit a deposit to reserve your kitten
4. Prepare your home
5. Receive your kitten with all documents

We offer worldwide shipping with proper documentation and health guarantees.

savannahHealth.question: What health guarantees do you provide?
savannahHealth.answer:
All our Savannah cats come with:

‚Ä¢ Comprehensive veterinary health examination
‚Ä¢ Up-to-date vaccinations
‚Ä¢ Parasite prevention treatments
‚Ä¢ Health guarantee documentation
‚Ä¢ Lifetime breeder support

We stand behind the health of every cat we place.

savannahShipping.question: Do you ship Savannah cats internationally?
savannahShipping.answer:
Yes, we offer worldwide shipping:

‚Ä¢ Safe, climate-controlled pet transport
‚Ä¢ All necessary health certificates and documentation
‚Ä¢ Door-to-door delivery available
‚Ä¢ Live arrival guarantee

Shipping costs are fully covered by us.

savannahDeposit.question: How much is the deposit and is it refundable?
savannahDeposit.answer:
Our deposit structure:

‚Ä¢ Deposit: 50% of the total price
‚Ä¢ Secures your chosen kitten
‚Ä¢ Applied toward the full purchase price
‚Ä¢ Non-refundable if you change your mind

We accept cryptocurrency (USDT, TON, SOL).
